Posts.Content: Thanks again for your advice everyone. Yes my family history does include prostate cancer, but it was my grandad on my fathers side, so I'm not sure if that counts?  Gemma
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis after finding a lump in ARMPIT

Posts.Content: Hi to all, my name is Gemma I'm 33 and a mother to four children, all under the age of 7... I was wondering if anyone could offer any advice/personal experience- of being diagnosed with breast cancer after finding a lump in an armpit. I have had a lump in my armpit for a very long time, probably longer than I care to admit... I sometimes felt it was there, and sometimes I wondered if it was a figment of my imagination... It's pretty much painless, but I started to notice it more recently, I made a doctors appiontment, and she confirmed it was a swollen lymph node roughly around 3cm in circumference. I am otherwise completely healthy. Thank you for your time, Gemma.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis after finding a lump in ARMPIT

Posts.Content: Thanks for your responses guys, yes I have been referred under a two week waiting time, so I'm hoping for an appointment letter next week, my doctor has asked that I have a mammogram, scan, and possible biopsy... I do have a family history of cancer, but not breast cancer. I have other symptoms from the enlarged lymph node, such as discomfort in my arm, and sometimes pain in my arm and general stiffness.. so I'm guessing from this, it is a enlarged lymph node.. I also have pain around my breast bone... did anyone experience any of these symtoms? Thank you greatly for your advice. Gemma
Posts.Title: Breast cancer diagnosis after finding a lump in ARMPIT
